embeds.title: Sixth Seal
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 3 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

​~~- **Ethereal**  -~~ **Seal.**
At the end of combat, gain an additional non-Sixth Seal card reward.

messages.content: VERY good metascaling
+2 str, +2 dex, +2 intensity
It's extremely good.
Also remove 6.
It's worth taking, but obviously don't chase broken seal unless you find this card.
But all of the seals are worth drafting.
Cheap powers on one side, super meta scaling on the other side.
Bolstering flame makes playing seals easier too.
also full heals you when you pop it
ALSO, if you ever find bottled anomaly, you can basically get the broken seal for free.
at the cost of the bottle, of course
The biggest question is "when do I cash out?"
IMO, "as late as possible" and "as soon as possible" are both equally viable

An early broken seal can allow for high aggression pathing, and you still get to keep one seal because you get one last 6th seal use. I personally recommend 5th seal to make your frontloaded damage even better as you progress into the late game, but a 3rd seal or 1st seal is also a good take.

And a late broken seal allows for a very refined and upgraded deck as you move into act 4, but you have to drag the seals around. Carrying all 6 seals into a reptomancer fight can be a complete death sentence.
I find that getting broken seal ASAP and then grabbing a 5th seal gives you the power you'll need in the late game, over a late cash out.
Something to note is that hexaghost has one card that dumps dexterity, shadow guise's exhausted form, nightmare guise.
There are a LOT of strength payoffs on hexaghost however.
Now when it comes to getting this card, 3rd seal is obviously right there and is your best chance at getting it from your act 1 or 2 boss. Possibly multiple stacks of 3rd seal even.

It's pretty much always worth going for broken seal if you get 6th seal, but it requires pathing away from elites and into long chains of regular combats. A great way to play the seals is with any form of afterlife block. Both ghost shield and hexaguard are good for different reasons here.
Ghost shield will allow you to turtle more as you take turns waiting for your seals, while hexaguard will allow you to draw them out faster.
And this is important when 6th seal costs 3.
So you're going to be eating chunks that turn.
Now a random act 1 6th seal is extremely greedy, but if you have a lot of random combats and campfires ahead of you, you can avoid elites and go for this before your act 1 boss.
But this thing is going to be complete dead weight vs any elite except lagavulin where you'll be able to get it off.
At the end of it, broken seal is a relic.
lol
dead branch is still better though LMAO
Go big or go home with this card. Very fun but good lord is it a big investment
This tends to push you farther into metascaling than is remotely healthy
it's funny that the seals are just six cards but i think of hexa as "the metascaling character" because of them
tbf most characters only have one card like that
it's true
unless you count all forms of healing as metascaling

the other seals always seemed a little too pushed to me (to different degrees, third being probably the most egregious) given their built-in upsides but having a consistent enabler for them is probably fine otherwise, idk
"you forgot to play sixth seal on that hallway fight"
https://tenor.com/view/trump-leaving-press-conference-gif-24778782

the seal cards are broken and this card gives you all of them. its a good idea to take extra seals from this because even after taking the broken seal relic its a great idea to have 1-2 copies of 5th seal to fully upgrade your deck, 2-3 third seals to get more ghost shields and a 4th seal to get a potion every fight.

this card is takeable from neow despite costing 3 and having no benefit until after the fight ends; 6th seal is a one way ticket to win any hexaghost run and is arguably the characters best rare card.
<<the broken seal>>

embeds.title: The Broken Seal
embeds.description:
Special Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Upon pickup, raise your Max HP by 10, then heal all of your HP. Start each combat with 2 **Strength** :p_strength:, 2 **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:, and 2 **Intensity** :p_intensity:. You can not receive The Broken Seal again.
*Unlimited, unrestrained, unquenchable power.*

messages.content:
Very powerful rare that offers tons of meta scaling potential. Most of the seals are fantastic (second seal being the weakest link IMO, but still good) and being able to essentially guarantee that you can successfully work towards creating a broken seal allows you to convert your efforts into a very strong relic that gives you permanent front-loaded stats, as well as a full heal on creation. Even beyond forming broken seal, being able to pick up extra copies of 5th seal (upgrades), a backup 4th seal (potion), and more copies of 3rd seal (extra card reward) can be extremely powerful to help scale your deck in other ways. The seals are a bit strange, in that not only is obtaining the broken seal a big payoff (while also removing the seals from your deck and thinning it nicely), but that the majority of them are just very useful cards to have even if you don't manage to build exodia. I feel like there should be more risk involved in stockpiling them, as the reward for getting them all is so powerful, but right now I don't think you get punished very hard for being greedy in your pursuit of broken seal (afterlife also contributes to this problem, giving you so much free output and block that you these sorts of slow meta scaling cards are too easy to include safely).

 Very happy to see this rare from a boss reward (and 3rd seal even gives you extra shots at it), would usually buy it at a shop assuming I could carry it for the next few floors with good potions or afterlife cards. It should be too greedy to take this from your heart bonus at the start of the run, but you can likely get away with it if you path away from elites, or go after afterlife/front-loaded cards more than normal to compensate (terrible into all 3 act 1 elites, and quite bad in most hallway fights, but having it that early can make the late game a breeze if you can survive the early game). Once you have 4 energy, sixth seal is much easier to play safely, especially with sword/shield of night.

Insane with snecko eye (as are many of hexaghosts cards, especially afterlife), bird faced urn, and mummified hand. Upgrade is something you don't really need (same for most seals), but could make sense if you have runic pyramid, and is okay if it comes pre upgraded from frozen egg. The strength it gives you can be very powerful with several different multi-hit cards, but is less valuable if you are heavily skewed towards soulburn as your primary damage. The dexterity is great with your free afterlife block cards and basic defends. Having the extra intensity makes all ghostflame related effects stronger, and makes you want to invest more in cards that let you get multiple ignitions at once. Even the Max HP is pretty handy to cover your somewhat low starting health, especially on higher ascensions. 

I feel like seals as a whole likely do deserve a nerf, I love the goal they provide, but it's a little too consistent, and generally too safe to go after considering how strong most of the seal cards are even if you never manage to never assemble broken seal. Sixth seal itself looks like it should be balanced by the high cost and low immediate impact, but I rarely feel like I get punished for including and casting it. I think that afterlife is the far bigger problem for Hexaghosts overall balance, and that ghost shield and hexaguard in particular stand out as ridiculously powerful cards that allow the seals to feel much easier to include safely than they ought to be.
Great way to get the other seals for sure. Broken seal is good too
Heard you like seals so we made a seal so you could get more seals
seal the deal :Seal:
